humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the size of the largest tumor as 2.2 x 1.6 x 1.6 cm. According to the rules provided, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for breast cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, it is stated that the size of the mass is 2.2 x 1.6 x 1.6 cm. According to the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) staging system, a T2 stage is given to tumors that are greater than 2 cm in size but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
